parts.text:
```json
{
  "application": "Singularity",
  "details": {
    "container_image": "/scratch/work/public/singularity/cuda11.8.86-cudnn8.7-devel-ubuntu22.04.2.sif",
    "overlay": "/scratch/$USER/my_env/overlay-50G-10M.ext3:ro",
    "environment_script": "/ext3/env.sh",
    "python_script": "main.py",
    "arguments": {
      "batch_size": 64,
      "lr": 0.00025,
      "discount_factor": 0.99,
      "num_epochs": 2,
      "memory_size": 10000,
      "frame_repeat": 12,
      "steps_per_epoch": 2000,
      "epsilon_decay": 0.9996,
      "model": "double_dqn",
      "checkpoint": "double_rocket",
      "scenario": "rocket_basic"
    },
    "slurm_parameters": {
      "job_name": "double_rocket",
      "nodes": 1,
      "ntasks_per_node": 1,
      "cpus_per_task": 8,
      "time": "06:00:00",
      "mem": "64GB",
      "priority": 4294967293,
      "account": "class",
      "output": "./out/double_rocket.out"
    }
  }
}
```

This script runs within a Singularity container, leveraging a GPU with the `--nv` flag. The container uses the image `/scratch/work/public/singularity/cuda11.8.86-cudnn8.7-devel-ubuntu22.04.2.sif`. It also mounts an overlay directory (`/scratch/$USER/my_env/overlay-50G-10M.ext3`) for read-only access.

The script then executes a Python script (`main.py`) within the container. The script takes several arguments, including training parameters, model specifications, and the scenario to run. 

The script utilizes SLURM (Simple Linux Utility for Resource Management) for resource allocation. It defines parameters such as the job name, number of nodes, CPUs per task, runtime, memory, priority, account, and output file location.
